servinfo.title: DTC P0544: Exhaust Gas Temperature Sensor 3 Circuit

item.ptxt: Conditions for applying fault finding procedures to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after the engine is started or following a road test.
If the fault is present, diesel particulate filter regenerations are not possible.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (Diesel Model) .

entry.ptxt: Open circuit or short circuit to +12 V
Short circuit to vehicle body ground
Check the condition of the connectors on the exhaust gas temperature sensor 3 and the ECM.
Check for the continuity, absence of interference resistance and insulation from +12 V for the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C88-1” wire of exhaust gas temperature sensor 3 connector and “C86-29” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C88-2” wire of exhaust gas temperature sensor 3 connector and “C85-11” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: Check the continuity, absence of interference resistance and insulation from vehicle body ground of the following connection:

item.ptxt: Between “C88-1” wire of exhaust gas temperature sensor 3 connector and “C86-29” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: Check for the presence of ground on “C88-2” wire of the exhaust gas temperature sensor 3 connector.
Check the sensor resistance between “C88-1” and “C88-2” terminals of the exhaust gas temperature sensor 3 connector according to parameter “Diesel PF out Temp” on Data list of SUZUKI scan tool.
If the recorded values do not correspond to the above values, replace the exhaust gas temperature sensor 3.
If the fault is still present, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
